ruleset.name: Virginia Tech Rules
ruleset.description: Contains custom PMD rules written at Virginia Tech, mostly regarding JUnit tests.

rule.name: JUnit3TestsHaveAssertions
rule.message: A test case method should use one or more 'assert...()' methods to check that the desired behavior is actually occurring.
rule.description: All JUnit test methods should contain at least one assertion.

property.name: xpath

rule.name: JUnit4TestsHaveAssertions
rule.message: A test case method should use one or more 'assert...()' methods to check that the desired behavior is actually occurring.
rule.description: All JUnit 4.x test methods should contain at least one assertion.

property.name: xpath
property.value: //MethodDeclaration [parent::ClassOrInterfaceBodyDeclaration[ child::Annotation[descendant::Name/@Image = "Test"] ]] [not(descendant::StatementExpression/PrimaryExpression/PrimaryPrefix/Name [starts-with(@Image, 'assert') or contains(@Image,'.assert') or @Image = 'fail' or contains(@Image,'.fail')] )]

rule.name: JUnit3ConstantAssertion
rule.message: This assertion uses only values known at compile time, so it cannot test any useful behavior exhibited by your code at run-time.
rule.description: All assertEquals() or assertTrue() assertions in JUnit test methods should contain one or more non-literal parameters.

property.name: xpath
property.value: //StatementExpression/PrimaryExpression[ PrimaryPrefix/Name/@Image='assertTrue' or PrimaryPrefix/Name/@Image='assertFalse' or PrimaryPrefix/Name/@Image='assertNotNull' or PrimaryPrefix/Name/@Image='assertNull' or PrimaryPrefix/Name/@Image='assertNotSame' or PrimaryPrefix/Name/@Image='assertSame' or PrimaryPrefix/Name/@Image='assertEquals'] [not(PrimarySuffix/Arguments/ArgumentList/descendant::PrimaryPrefix/Name or PrimarySuffix/Arguments/ArgumentList/descendant::PrimaryExpression/PrimaryPrefix/@ThisModifier='true')] [ancestor::ClassOrInterfaceDeclaration[ count( ExtendsList[ ClassOrInterfaceType[ends-with(@Image, 'TestCase')]] ) > 0 ]]

rule.name: JUnit4ConstantAssertion
rule.message: This assertion uses only values known at compile time, so it cannot test any useful behavior exhibited by your code at run-time.
rule.description: All assertEquals() or assertTrue() assertions in JUnit 4.x test methods should contain one or more non-literal parameters.

property.name: xpath
property.value: //StatementExpression/PrimaryExpression[ PrimaryPrefix/Name/@Image='assertTrue' or PrimaryPrefix/Name/@Image='assertFalse' or PrimaryPrefix/Name/@Image='assertNotNull' or PrimaryPrefix/Name/@Image='assertNull' or PrimaryPrefix/Name/@Image='assertNotSame' or PrimaryPrefix/Name/@Image='assertSame' or PrimaryPrefix/Name/@Image='assertEquals'] [not(PrimarySuffix/Arguments/ArgumentList/descendant::PrimaryPrefix/Name or PrimarySuffix/Arguments/ArgumentList/descendant::PrimaryExpression/PrimaryPrefix/@ThisModifier='true')] [ancestor::MethodDeclaration [parent::ClassOrInterfaceBodyDeclaration[ child::Annotation[descendant::Name/@Image = "Test"] ]]]

rule.name: JUnitTestClassNeedsTestCase
rule.message: This JUnit test class does not contain any actual tests.
rule.description: All JUnit test classes should contain a test method.

rule.name: FormalParametersNeedMeaningfulNames
rule.message: A formal parameter has been left with its auto-generated default name instead of a more meaningful name.
rule.description: When using a development environment that can auto-generate empty method definitions, you should change the auto-generated formal parameter names to something more meaningful.

rule.name: ProhibitedGreenfootImport
rule.message: Do not import greenfoot.* packages or classes, since they are not available under Android.
rule.description: When using Greenfoot4Sofia, do not import any greenfoot.* packages or classes, since these are not intended for use by user projects and are completely unavailable under Android.
